SEARCH
Package com.kneelawk.knet.api.util

Interface NetBuf<B extends net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf & NetBuf<? super B>>

Type Parameters:
B - the implementing buffer.
All Known Implementing Classes:
NetByteBuf, NetRegistryByteBuf, RegistryNetByteBuf
public interface NetBuf<B extends net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf & NetBuf<? super B>>
Super-interface for all net buffers to make sure they have the same interface and implement the same methods.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static final class 
    NetBuf.SavedReaderIndex
    Holds an index into a NetByteBuf that can be restored.

    • copy

      io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf copy()
      Returns a copy of this buffer's readable bytes. Modifying the content of the returned buffer or this buffer does not affect each other at all. This method is identical to buf.copy(buf.readerIndex(), buf.readableBytes()). This method does not modify readerIndex or writerIndex of this buffer.
      Returns:
      a copy of this buffer.

    • readBytes

      io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf readBytes(int length)
      Transfers this buffer's data to a newly created buffer starting at the current readerIndex and increases the readerIndex by the number of the transferred bytes (= length). The returned buffer's readerIndex and writerIndex are 0 and length respectively.

      Note: this will not carry partial reads over to the returned buffer.

      Parameters:
      length - the number of bytes to transfer
      Returns:
      the newly created buffer which contains the transferred bytes
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if length is greater than this.readableBytes

    • clear

      net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf clear()
      Sets the readerIndex and writerIndex of this buffer to 0 while resetting the partial byte data.

      Please note that the behavior of this method is different from that of NIO buffer, which sets the limit to the capacity of the buffer.

      Returns:
      this buffer.

    • markReaderIndex

      net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf markReaderIndex()
      Marks the current readerIndex in this buffer. You can reposition the current readerIndex to the marked readerIndex by calling resetReaderIndex(). The initial value of the marked readerIndex is 0.
      Returns:
      this buffer.

    • resetReaderIndex

      net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf resetReaderIndex()
      Repositions the current readerIndex to the marked readerIndex in this buffer.
      Returns:
      this buffer.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the current writerIndex is less than the marked readerIndex

    • saveReaderIndex

      NetBuf.SavedReaderIndex saveReaderIndex()
      Creates a saved reader index that can be restored to continue reading from the position of this buffer when this method was called.
      Returns:
      the saved reader index used for restoring the buffer's position.

    • resetReaderIndex

      B resetReaderIndex(NetBuf.SavedReaderIndex index)
      Restores the buffer's reader position to the saved reader index.
      Parameters:
      index - the saved reader index of the position to restore the buffer to.
      Returns:
      this buffer.

    • writeBoolean

      net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf writeBoolean(boolean flag)
      Writes a single boolean out to some position in this buffer. The boolean flag might be written to a new byte (increasing the writerIndex) or it might be added to an existing byte that was written with a previous call to this method.
      Parameters:
      flag - the boolean to write.
      Returns:
      this buffer.

    • readBoolean

      boolean readBoolean()
      Reads a single boolean from some position in this buffer. The boolean flag might be read from a new byte (increasing the readerIndex) or it might be read from a previous byte that was read with a previous call to this method.
      Returns:
      the read boolean.

    • writeFixedBits

      default B writeFixedBits(int value, int length) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Writes a fixed number of bits out to the stream.
      Parameters:
      value - the value to write out.
      length - The number of bits to write.
      Returns:
      This buffer.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the length argument was less than 1 or greater than 32.

    • readFixedBits

      default int readFixedBits(int length) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Reads a fixed number of bits from the given stream.
      Parameters:
      length - The number of bits to read.
      Returns:
      The read bits, compacted into an int.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the length argument was less than 1 or greater than 32.

    • writeEnum

      net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf writeEnum(Enum<?> value)
      Writes an enum constant to this buf. An enum constant is represented by a var int indicating its ordinal.
      Parameters:
      value - the enum constant to write.
      Returns:
      this buf, for chaining.
      See Also:
      • readEnum(Class)

    • readEnum

      <E extends Enum<E>> E readEnum(Class<E> enumClass)
      Reads an enum constant from this buf. An enum constant is represented by a var int indicating its ordinal.
      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of enum to read.
      Parameters:
      enumClass - the enum class, for constant lookup.
      Returns:
      the read enum constant.
      See Also:
      • writeEnum(Enum)

      Returns:
      the read chunk section pos.

    • writeVarInt

      net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf writeVarInt(int ival)
      Writes out an integer using a variable number of bytes.
      • 1 byte for MIN_VAR_S_INT_1_BYTE to MAX_VAR_S_INT_1_BYTE
      • 2 bytes for MIN_VAR_S_INT_2_BYTES to MAX_VAR_S_INT_2_BYTES
      • 3 bytes for MIN_VAR_S_INT_3_BYTES to MAX_VAR_S_INT_3_BYTES
      • 4 bytes for MIN_VAR_S_INT_4_BYTES to MAX_VAR_S_INT_4_BYTES
      • 5 bytes for Integer.MIN_VALUE to Integer.MAX_VALUE

      Unlike vanilla this doesn't use 5 bytes for all negative numbers.

      Parameters:
      ival - the integer value to write.
      Returns:
      this buffer.

    • readVarInt

      int readVarInt()
      Reads out an integer using a variable number of bytes, assuming it was written by writeVarInt(int)
      Returns:
      the read variable-length integer.

    • writeVarUnsignedInt

      B writeVarUnsignedInt(int ival)
      Exposes the vanilla method for writing out an unsigned integer using a variable number of bytes.
      • 1 byte for MIN_VAR_U_INT_SMALL to MAX_VAR_S_INT_1_BYTE
      • 2 bytes for MIN_VAR_U_INT_SMALL to MAX_VAR_S_INT_2_BYTES
      • 3 bytes for MIN_VAR_U_INT_SMALL to MAX_VAR_S_INT_3_BYTES
      • 4 bytes for MIN_VAR_U_INT_SMALL to MAX_VAR_S_INT_4_BYTES
      • 5 bytes for Integer.MIN_VALUE to Integer.MAX_VALUE

      Unlike writeVarInt(int) this only uses less than 5 bytes for non-negative integers less than pow(2, 8 * 3 - 1) ()

      Parameters:
      ival - the unsigned integer value to write.
      Returns:
      this buffer.

    • readVarUnsignedInt

      int readVarUnsignedInt()
      Exposes the vanilla method for reading an unsigned integer using a variable number of bytes.

      Unlike readVarInt() this only uses less than 5 bytes for non-negative integers less than pow(2, 8 * 3 - 1) ()

      Returns:
      the read unsigned integer value.

    • writeVarLong

      net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf writeVarLong(long lval)
      Writes out a long integer using a variable number of bytes.
      • 1 byte for -64 to 63
      • 2 bytes for -8,192 to 8,191
      • 3 bytes for -1,048,576 to 1,048,575
      • 4 bytes for -134,217,728 to 134,217,727

      Unlike vanilla this doesn't use 9 bytes for all negative numbers.

      Parameters:
      lval - the long integer value to write.
      Returns:
      this buffer.

    • readVarLong

      long readVarLong()
      Reads a single var long from this buf.
      Returns:
      the value read
      See Also:
      • writeVarLong(long)

    • writeVarUnsignedLong

      B writeVarUnsignedLong(long lval)
      Exposes the vanilla method for writing out an unsigned long integer using a variable number of bytes.

      Unlike writeVarInt(int) this only uses less than 9 bytes for non-negative integers less than pow(2, 8 * 7 - 1) ()

      Parameters:
      lval - the unsigned long integer value to write.
      Returns:
      this buffer.

    • readVarUnsignedLong

      long readVarUnsignedLong()
      Exposes the vanilla method for reading an unsigned long integer using a variable number of bytes.

      Unlike readVarInt() this only uses less than 9 bytes for non-negative integers less than pow(2, 8 * 7 - 1) ()

      Returns:
      the read unsigned long integer value.

    • readIdentifierOrNull

      @Nullable @Nullable net.minecraft.resources.ResourceLocation readIdentifierOrNull()
      Like FriendlyByteBuf.readResourceLocation(), but returns null instead of throwing an error if the read string was invalid.

      Note: this will attempt to read a string from the buffer regardless of whether that string is a valid ResourceLocation.

      Returns:
      the valid identifier read, or null if the read string did not represent a valid identifier.

    • readUtf

      String readUtf()
      Reads a string of up to Short.MAX_VALUE length.

      NOTE: This is just FriendlyByteBuf.readUtf() but available on the server as well.

      Returns:
      the read string.

    • writeNetOptional

      default <T> B writeNetOptional(Optional<T> value, net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamEncoder<? super B,T> writer)
      Writes an optional value to this buf. An optional value is represented by a boolean indicating if the value is present, followed by the value only if the value is present.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type this method optionally writes.
      Parameters:
      value - the optional value to write.
      writer - the packet writer capable of writing the value.
      Returns:
      this buffer.
      See Also:
      • readNetOptional(StreamDecoder)

    • readNetOptional

      default <T> Optional<T> readNetOptional(net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamDecoder<? super B,T> reader)
      Reads an optional value from this buf. An optional value is represented by a boolean indicating if the value is present, followed by the value only if the value is present.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type this method optionally reads.
      Parameters:
      reader - the packet reader capable of reading the value.
      Returns:
      the read optional value
      See Also:
      • writeNetOptional(Optional, StreamEncoder)

      value - the value to write.
      writer - the writer for the given type.

      this buffer.

    • writeNetArray

      default <T> B writeNetArray(T[] array, net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamEncoder<? super B,T> writer)

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the array to write.
      Parameters:
      array - the array to write.
      writer - the writer for the given type.
      Returns:
      this buffer.

    • writeNetMap

      default <K, V> B writeNetMap(Map<K,V> map, net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamEncoder<? super B,K> keyWriter, net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamEncoder<? super B,V> valueWriter)
      Writes a map to this buf. The map is represented by a length unsigned var int, followed by key-value pairs.
      Type Parameters:
      K - the key type.
      V - the value type.
      Parameters:
      map - the map to write.
      keyWriter - the writer for the keys.
      valueWriter - the write for the values.
      Returns:
      this buffer.

    • readNetMap

      default <K, V, M extends Map<K, V>> M readNetMap(IntFunction<M> mapCtor, net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamDecoder<? super B,K> keyReader, net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamDecoder<? super B,V> valueReader)
      Reads a map from this buf. The map is represented by a length unsigned var int, followed by key-value pairs.
